meanings.definition: A young mammal that is still nursing.
meanings.sent1: The farm had a cute suckling piglet.
meanings.sent2: The mother cat cared for her suckling kittens.
meanings.sent3: The zoo visitors chuckled at the playful suckling baby monkey.
meanings.sent4: The forest was alive with the sounds of suckling fawns.
meanings.sent5: The image of the suckling calf was heartwarming.

meanings.definition: The act of nursing at the breast.
meanings.sent1: The suckling of the baby was a comforting sight.
meanings.sent2: The mother's embrace during suckling was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The family gathered around to witness the suckling of the newborn.
meanings.sent4: The suckling of the infant brought a sense of peace to the room.
meanings.sent5: The suckling of the child was a natural bond between mother and baby.

meanings.sent1: The playground was filled with happy sucklings playing.
meanings.sent2: The daycare center was bustling with sucklings and their caregivers.
meanings.sent3: The giggles of the suckling echoed through the room.
meanings.sent4: The suckling in the stroller waved at passersby.
meanings.sent5: The suckling in the crib drifted off to sleep peacefully.
